question:
Consider the following statements about the Rashtriya Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan (RUSA):
  1. It aims to increase the Gross Enrolment Ratio of the country and provide strategic funding to state universities and higher educational institutions.
  2. The scheme also aims to provide adequate opportunities to socially deprived communities and differently abled persons to pursue higher education
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Recently, the Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs chaired by the Prime Minister Narendra Modi has given its approval for the second phase of Rashtriya Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan (RUSA). It is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme launched in 2013. <u>First statement is correct</u>. It seeks to increase the Gross Enrolment Ratio of the country and provide strategic funding to state universities and higher educational institutions. The 2nd phase of the scheme envisages creating 70 new model degree colleges and 8 new professional colleges. The funding to States under this scheme is based on critical appraisal of State Higher Education Plans. The project cost in the public funded institutions for all sub-components is shared between the Central Government and State Governments in the ratio of 90:10 for North-Eastern States, J&K, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand, 60:40 for other States and UTs with Legislature and 100:0 for UTs without Legislature. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. The scheme also aims to facilitate socially deprived communities; SC/ST/OBCs; differently abled persons; women and minorities to pursue higher education.
